contentrichtext.text: In [[telecommunication]], the term '''foreign instrumentation signals intelligence''' (FISINT) has the following meanings: '''1.''' Intelligence [[information]] derived from electromagnetic emissions associated with the testing and operational deployment of foreign aerospace, surface, and subsurface systems. '''2.''' Technical information and intelligence information derived from the [[Signals intelligence|intercept]] of foreign instrumentation signals by other than the intended recipients. Foreign instrumentation [[signals intelligence]] is a category of signals intelligence. Foreign instrumentation signals include but are not limited to signals from [[telemetry]], beaconry, electronic interrogators, tracking/fusing/arming/firing [[Command (computing)|command]] systems, and [[video]] [[data]] links. ==References== *{{FS1037C}} *{{DODDIC}} [[Category:Intelligence gathering disciplines]] {{telecomm-stub}}
